meanings.definition: Move slowly and carefully in small increments.
meanings.sent1: The snail inched along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She inched closer to the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The turtle inched its way to the finish line, winning the race.
meanings.sent4: Time inched forward, bringing them closer to their destination.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar inched its way up the leaf, one tiny step at a time.

meanings.definition: To advance or move forward gradually.
meanings.sent1: The line inched forward as more people joined.
meanings.sent2: He inched his way through the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The car inched forward in the traffic jam, barely moving.
meanings.sent4: The shadow inched closer, creeping along the wall.
meanings.sent5: The boat inched its way towards the shore, guided by the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To move or push something slowly or gradually.
meanings.sent1: She inched the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: He inched the door open to peek inside.
meanings.sent3: The cat inched the ball of yarn off the table, playing a sneaky game.
meanings.sent4: The old clock inched its hands towards midnight, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The gardener inched the plant towards the sunlight, ensuring its growth.
